did.abstract: Correspondence, memoranda, and trial transcripts, relating to "The Long March" of the 1st Division, U.S. Infantry, into German occupied areas following World War I; German military operations in the West during World War II; and German war crime trials, especially the Buchenwald Concentration Camp case, 1947-1948. Includes a report by W. H. Scheidt, Historian, Oberkommando der Wehrmacht, entitled German Military Operations Report, 1944-1945.

did.unittitle: "German Military Operations Report, June 1944 - March 1945," a history of German military operations in the West from D-Day until March 1945. Written at Military Intelligence Service Center, United States Army, by the official historian of the German Armed Forces High Command, Dr. Wilhelm Heinrich Scheidt. Used by Donald McClure, Lt. Colonel, United States Air Force, in reviewing the Malmedy Massacre Case, Frankfurt, Germany, 1948

"Buchenwald Concentration Camp Case." Records, documents, memoranda, and exhibits used in review of the Buchenwald Concentration Camp Case by Donald McClure, Lt. Colonel, United States Air Force, Frankfurt, Germany,

"German Crime Trials." Basic rules, procedures, precedents used during the German war crime trials, reviews, and appeals, used by Donald McClure, Lt. Colonel, United States Air Force, Dachau, Munich, and Frankfurt, Germany,
